subject: Business
title: Minimum Viable Products
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Minimum Viable Products.

hook.text: Zappos tested online shoe sales with zero inventory â€” just photos from local stores.

buildup.text: An MVP is the smallest version of a product that tests a real assumption with real users.

discovery.text: The goal isn't a stripped-down product. It's the fastest path to validated learning.

twist.text: Most teams over-build their MVP. If you're not embarrassed by it, you launched too late.

climax.text: Airbnb's MVP was a single webpage with photos of three air mattresses in San Francisco.

punchline.text: Build less. Learn more. Ship embarrassingly small.

quiz.question: What is the primary purpose of an MVP?
options: To test assumptions with the least effort
To impress investors with a polished product
